hearsay --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">sea within us tries out sentences --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Sometimes one of us stands near the sea --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">On nice days, the open sea shimmers --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Blue's recovery after the downpour ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">\"There were some unusual clouds that year\" --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">\"The sky's substance is strangely tender\" --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Dark-eyed women have a blue gaze --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Do not think all this blue is without pain --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">In summer, in the evening ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">They move about --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Alive, they proceed hands first --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">sea is a picture book --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">They look at the blue, but will never know how to say it --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">They are sometimes seen beneath lampposts --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">He's heading out to sea is what they say of someone embarking on a journey ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">They leave their islands to go to sea --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">He picks up a pen or a paintbrush --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Orthodoxy of blue --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">For centuries, she's been beating --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">sea is the gods' vacancy --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Sometimes, it's only the light sound of forks against earthenware --</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"8\" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"505\"><subfield code=\"t\">Soon there was nothing left of belief but the memory of its color --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Nothing remains but an empty gesture resembling prayer --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Sometimes words hurry --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Soul --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">There --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Blue makes no noise --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">All this blue is not the same ink --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">We don't know : we don't understand --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Blue increases and reproduces on the debris of our life --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">blue of the sky can do without our help --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Like a cloth, the sky soaks --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">blue around here blurs when night falls --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">There is nothing that can be locked up in a book --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">This blue belongs to no one --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">sea's masts are illusory --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Bugles, horses of the deep, mouth of the sea! --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">With my dulcimers, my trumpet and my timpani --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Here we strike the iron of the soul --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">man swimming there is an iodine and cobalt poem --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Unending narration of the open sea --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">So much light in tears --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">From all over, she flows --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">horizon of slate and slag --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">You there, the tiny body of a transfixed man ... --</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"8\" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"505\"><subfield code=\"t\">You're soaking in dreams, you lose your foothold in yourself --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">White swimmer in the sea's arms --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Use this blue to compose --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Don't balk at the expense --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">You have blue at your fingertips --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">You burn with your sentences --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">And you there, smeared with cherries? --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">You were the bluest in your dress --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Nine days at sea as in a church --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">This blue sticks to my lips --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Start from nothing, emphasize this nothing --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">I've been putting words next to words for a long time --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">In language, I contemplate the blue of the sky --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">For me, writing is about departing --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">I cannot survive in the impossible --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Late in the autumn, when the rain falls with a soft noise ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Everything I've loved, everything I've lost ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Death falls asleep right against the sea --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Aluminum-colored fish wander in the sea's baggage holds --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Along the cliffs and beaches, the sea looks after our remains --</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"8\" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"505\"><subfield code=\"t\">In the evening when it pulls back to leave all the room to darkness ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">edge of the world is quite near ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Broken old women move about all evening ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">heart of crushed glass --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">What kind of snow continuously falls ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Does the sky enjoy hearing this faint sound of a creaking heart? --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Emma liked blue --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Her dresses must be mentioned --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">When she loosens her dress, the man is silent --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">No one can express her desire --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">If you call her, she doesn't come --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">She sometimes remembers her childhood --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">So many days have passed .. --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Some say she once dreamed of evaporating --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Loves is what she calls these departing sailors and sailboats on the open sea ...</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"1\" ind2=\" \" tag=\"700\"><subfield code=\"a\">Cornelio, Dawn M.</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\" \" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"830\"><subfield code=\"a\">Lannan translations selection discoveryutils.title: Result number value for articles does not match up to results in Articles+

figgy.title: Index more numismatics fields into Orangelight
I would like a csv download of a subset of numismatics with their source metadata identifier and if the images are *not* yet labeled "obverse" and "reverse".

comments.body: Hi, @eliotjordan ! one of the SC folks asked me about this. Is it possible for me to give them an approx timeframe as to when we can get the list to them? Thank you so much!

figgy.title: Some Finding Aids fields are not showing up in Figgy and one field is mapped to the wrong place in Figgy

comments.body:
Here's where the creator field is coming from:

- https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/master/app/services/pul_metadata_services/client.rb#L42 retrieves a record from the findingaids site. NB: this is not the EAD; it is the enhanced EAD that is produced during ingest into pulfa.
- https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/master/app/services/pul_metadata_services/pulfa_record.rb#L59 maps `creator` and `publisher` to `collection_creators`, which is an "enhanced" (non-EAD) field in the retrieved record https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/blob/master/app/services/pul_metadata_services/pulfa_record.rb#L121

This might be the right value to use for a whole collection (though I would suggest the `origination` element in the EAD's top-level `did` would be the better value to use), but for constituents, `creator` should be mapped to the component-level `ead:c/ead:did/ead:origination` element.

marc_liberation.title: Set up a webhook listener for Alma bib record updates

comments.body: @mzelesky The documentation says webhooks aren't fired for jobs that affect > 500k records. Do we do these commonly? If so we'll still need periodic full reindexes.
https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/blog/hosting-a-webhook-listener-in-aws/ is some nice documentation for running this kind of stuff in a lambda.

We occasionally modify more than 500,000 records in a day. What Chris Clement recommended is we use webhooks to attempt to keep up throughout the day with changes, then still use the daily incremental update to catch anything missed.
@mzelesky ah, okay. I didn't see documentation about incremental updates - was under the impression the daily dumps were full dumps.

This might help explain some things: https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Product_Documentation/010Alma_Online_Help_(English)/090Integrations_with_External_Systems/030Resource_Management/080Publishing_and_Inventory_Enrichment
This how the Locations Object looks like https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_locations.xsd/?tags=GET

comments.body: We decided with the Alma group to brake down this issue in different scenarios. This will help to improve the way we retrieve currently the availability.
